title_description: Axies are fierce, adorable creatures that love to battle, build and hunt for treasure.
classes_description: Axies are categorized into 9 different Classes based on their body type:
classes_description_2: Look, an Axie! This Axie has Plant type body, so we classify it as a Plant Axie.
body_parts_text_1: Each Axie has 6 different body parts that determine which
body_parts_text_2: it can use in battle. In other words, each body part corresponds to one unique ability.
body_parts_text_3: There are over 200 different body parts and nearly an infinite number of ways to combine them to build your next favorite Axie.
cards_intro: Remember that Plant Axie we encountered earlier? Let's see what Cards it has!

cards_data.card_text: Initial, pick 1 Plant card from your Discard Pile; otherwise, pick from your Draw Pile. Put the card on top of your Draw Pile. .
Target any Ally. Cleanse the target 2 times and grant it 2 Leaf.
If the target has Fragile, heal 20 HP to self. Otherwise, apply Fragile for 4 turns.
If Initial, deal 15 bonus DMG and apply {Taunt} to self for 2 turns.
Target any ally. Put 2 Burns into your opponent's Discard Pile.

potential_text_1: All axies will have a total of 15 Potential Points. Each axie part provides 2 class Potential Points. The axie's body provides 3 class Potential Points.
potential_text_2: Each Axie has a certain number of Potential Points which influence the
potential_text_4: An axieâ€™s Potential Points are derived from its body parts. Potential Points belong to specific Classes based on the related body part. For example, reptile body parts grant reptile potential points.
potential_text_5: As an example, let's say we have an Axie with a Reptile type body, 2 Reptile body parts, 2 bug body parts, 1 bird body part and 1 beast body part. This Axie's Potential Points would be:
charms_text_1: A Charm will require Potential Points of a matching Class.
charms_text_2: reduce an Axie's available Potential Points when they are allocated.
charms_text_3: For example, to equip an Aquatic Charm, an Axie must have Aquatic Potential Points. Once this Charm is equipped, the Axie's total available Aquatic Potential Points will be reduced. This is called the Potential Cost of a Charm.
charms_text_4: Wondering how many Potential Points your Axie has? Use the
powerups_description_1: Power-ups enable you to customize your Axie's abilities:
powerups_description_2: Where do you get these power-ups? This is the exciting part. Some Runes and Charms can be crafted, while others can only be collected in-game or acquired from special events.
runes_text: give Axies special passive effects that automatically activate in battle. You can equip 1 Rune per Axie.
charms_text: enhance the abilities that Axies get from their Cards. You can equip 1 Charm per Card or 6 Charms in total.
axies_description: In Axie Infinity: Origins, you can collect two types of Axies:

axies_data.title: Starter Axies
axies_data.description: Starter Axies are lovable in-game characters that make it easy to start playing Axie Infinity for free. Players receive 3 Starter Axies when they arrive in Lunacia and can unlock more Starter Axies by progressing in Adventure Mode.

axies_data.title: Personal Axies
axies_data.description: Personal Axies are non-fungible tokens (NFTs) that live on the blockchain. They have all of the utility of Starter Axies plus they can be bought, sold and traded with other players on the Marketplace. Personal Axies can also breed to create more Axies!
